thread.title: There's MORE bad news for Arsenal as sickness bug hits squad before FA Cup clash with giant-killers Lincoln
thread.title_full: There's MORE bad news for Arsenal as sickness bug hits squad before FA Cup clash with giant-killers Lincoln

author: John Cross
title: There's MORE bad news for Arsenal as sickness bug hits squad before FA Cup clash with giant-killers Lincoln
text:
The illness knocked Danny Welbeck (left) and Alex Iwobi out of Tuesday's loss to Bayern (Photo: Arsenal FC) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsenal are worried about losing more players to a bug sweeping through the club. 
Mesut Ozil went down sick last week, missing three days of training and the trip to Liverpool last Saturday. 
Alex Iwobi and Danny Welbeck were both victims before Tuesday's disastrous Bayern Munich game, with the latter pulling out of the planned starting XI during the warm-up. 
Ozil was promoted to the bench as a result, despite doing just one session. 
Now, the medical staff are on red alert to make sure no one else is affected. Welbeck's late withdrawal led to Ozil, who has also had the bug, being hastily added as a sub (Photo: Arsenal/Getty) Read More JOHN CROSS: Wenger is in danger of leaving the club he loves in utter chaos 
Boss Arsene Wenger is anxious that he has a strong and fully fit squad for Saturday’s FA Cup tie with Lincoln. 
* MATT RHEAD says his Lincoln side are ready to pile more misery on Arsenal by making them the biggest scalp of their run to the last eight, writes Derek Davis . 
Lincoln have beaten League One's Oldham, Championship duo Ipswich and Brighton and Premier League Burnley to become the first non-League side in the quarter-finals since 1914. 
As the Gunners were being smashed again by Bayern Munich on Tuesday night, the Imps were winning 4-0 against Braintree to extend their unbeaten run to 16 games and stretch their lead at the top of the National League to six points. Lincoln's fairytale could officially enter dreamland at the Emirates on Saturday (Photo: Getty Images) Read More Arsenal make Ozil HUGE offer to stay — but Oxlade-Chamberlain looks set for move 
“You never know,” smiled striker Rhead. “People said we had no chance against Oldham, Brighton, Ipswich and Burnley. We are used to people doubting us but we have a good set of lads and we keep doing what we have to do. 
“Last season we were probably a bit too direct. The gaffer came in and said we have players who can play a bit so why not use that. 
"We can still be direct when needed and we can mix it up, but we can also get the ball down and play a bit and some teams struggle with that. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
